sentence: Moving a step ahead in powering its entire operation with clean energy, salesforce.com, Inc.CRM recently signed its second energy agreement.
This deal comes on the heels of disclosing the first one but is much smaller.
The company recently entered into a deal with developer, EDF Renewable Energy, to purchase 24 megawatts (MW) of its new wind project's anticipated capacity located in Texas.
The project which is likely to be completed by the end of this year will generate 102,000 MW hours of clean energy annually.
Last month, Salesforce signed an agreement to buy 40 MW of the total capacity of a new wind farm developed by Enbridge ENB in West Virginia.
The project, to be completed by the end of 2016, will likely generate 125,000 MW hours of clean energy every year.
It should be noted that both the deals have been entered under the 'virtual power purchase agreement' with 12-year duration.
Under such an agreement, the power purchased is not directly fed to the company's facilities but added to the nearby electric grid.
Salesforce revealed that the combined deals will have the capacity to generate more electricity than it had used in 2015.
In the recent times, various large technology companies prefer to purchase electricity from renewable energy developers to power their facilities.
Some of the big corporate houses which have made such arrangements in recent past are Alphabet Inc. GOOGL , Microsoft and Apple Inc. AAPL .

Citing Herve Touati, a managing director at non-profit Rocky Mountain Institute and head of the Business Renewables Center, Network World revealed, in 2015, corporate buyers signed 3 gigawatts (GW) of renewable energy agreements as against 1.2 GW in 2014.

Per Bloomberg , " The strategy enables businesses to lock-in long-term fixed prices, which may be cheaper than buying energy from their local utilities, while promoting themselves as environmentally responsible."
The recently concluded climate convention in Paris has raised awareness as well as encouraged various corporate and businessmen to take robust measures to curb carbon emission.
The increased use of renewable energy by Salesforce and other technology companies will reduce global warming and fossil fuel consumption.
